RelatedSentence: PRIVATE hospital group Netcare reported on Monday that its adjusted headline earnings per share for the six months ended March 2014 increased 19.5 % to 75.9c .

A1: an interim dividend of 32c per share
RelatedSentence: Netcare declared an interim dividend of 32c per share , up 18.5 % from the year - earlier period .
The company said its group revenue grew 17.3 % to R15.411bn , while earnings before interest , taxes , depreciation and amortisation increased by 17.2 % to R3.248bn .
It said the group generated an increase in cash from operations of 40.5 % to R2.609bn .
It said the group generated an increase in cash from operations of 40.5 % to R2.609bn .
On the outlook for its divisions , Netcare said it expected the demand for private healthcare within South Africa to remain strong .
On the outlook for its divisions , Netcare said it expected the demand for private healthcare within South Africa to remain strong .
The business will continue to drive clinical excellence and maintain its operational efficiency programmes .
The business will continue to drive clinical excellence and maintain its operational efficiency programmes .

It will continue work on improving occupancies , along with the focused expansion of Netcare 's facilities and geographic footprint and leverage the opportunity for environmental upgrades in the process , Netcare said .

RelatedSentence: It will continue work on improving occupancies , along with the focused expansion of Netcare 's facilities and geographic footprint and leverage the opportunity for environmental upgrades in the process , Netcare said .
On its division in the UK , it said economic data indicated that the economy there was beginning to recover .

A1: their focus on building caseload and complexity
RelatedSentence: With the distractions of the competition commission investigation out of the way and certain marginal sites exited , management will direct their focus on building caseload and complexity , while maintaining tight control of costs .
We remain optimistic about the medium and longer - term prospects of the UK business , Netcare said .
